content:
Diagnosis
	1. Right breast invasive lobular carcinoma with solitary T4 vertebral metastasis

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative - disease control

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	12 Jan 2024 Core biopsy right breast and CT-guided bone biopsy

	Systemic therapy
	1. MAINTAIN Trial randomisation 15 Feb 2024
	2. Ribociclib 600mg/day D1-21 + Letrozole 2.5mg/day commenced 20 Feb 2024
	3. Denosumab 120mg monthly commenced March 2024

	Radiotherapy
	20Gy in 5 fractions to T4 vertebral metastasis completed 10 Mar 2024

	Clinical studies
	MAINTAIN Phase III trial - CDK4/6 inhibitor maintenance study

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on first restaging CT 15 April 2024

	Current issues
	Grade 2 neutropenia, Grade 1 fatigue

	Summary of consultation
	This 58-year-old lady attended for Cycle 3 Day 1 trial assessment. She has completed two cycles of protocol therapy with ribociclib and letrozole. Her main symptoms have been fatigue, particularly in the evenings, though this has improved from grade 2 to grade 1 over the past week. She reports good compliance with the oral medications. Her back pain has significantly improved following palliative radiotherapy, now only requiring occasional paracetamol.

Her blood tests today show neutrophils 1.2 x 10^9/L (Grade 2), which is an improvement from 0.9 last week. Liver function tests remain within normal range. ECG shows no significant changes with QTc 440ms.

As per trial protocol, we have completed the Quality of Life questionnaires and toxicity assessment. The patient remains ECOG PS 1.

	Further investigations
	Next trial-mandated CT scan due in 8 weeks

	Medication prescribed
	Continue current doses:
	Ribociclib 600mg daily D1-21
	Letrozole 2.5mg daily
	Denosumab 120mg monthly

	Follow up
	Next trial assessment in 3 weeks
Trial CT scan in 8 weeks

	Required trial protocol actions
	Quality of Life questionnaires completed
Adverse event documentation updated
Trial blood samples processed

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: ER 90% positive, PR 85% positive, HER2 negative

cancer_timeline.value: Core biopsy right breast and CT-guided bone biopsy
Randomised to MAINTAIN trial - CDK4/6 inhibitor maintenance study
Completed 20Gy in 5 fractions to T4 vertebral metastasis
CT shows stable disease on first restaging

patient_facts.value: Improved back pain, requiring occasional paracetamol only
Liver function tests within normal range

status_updates.value: Metastatic breast cancer on MAINTAIN trial with CDK4/6 inhibitor. Stable disease on first restaging with improving symptoms and manageable toxicity
Stable disease on CT, improved back pain following radiotherapy
Continuing Ribociclib 600mg daily D1-21 and Letrozole 2.5mg daily at current doses
